data.title: Refactor Domain Index possible performance improvements.
data.body:
Just some observations regarding the domain indices, and not from actual testing for performance issues (my computer is probably too fast to notice performance issues).

1) domain indices are built after a map is loaded, it seems as though it is something that could be done before or when saving the map and avoided when loading the map. It will increase the map size but it is easily compressed, maybe simple run length encoding will be enough.
2) If the map starts with a destroyed bridge, you end up with separate domains which is good for performance (early rejection before heavier path finding). When the bridge is repaired it creates a permanent connection between the domains to not reject path finding across those domains but when it is destroyed again those connections are not removed so you lose that benefit and will do heavier path finding each time after.
3) If the map starts with a bridge not destroyed it creates a single domain between both sides of the bridge, it loses out on the early rejection from #2 when the bridge is destroyed. It will do a heavier path search if there are no connection between both sides of the bridge.

So for #2 and #3, it would make sense that bridges are somehow ignored when building a domain index, separating both sides of a bridge into separate domains (unless there is a non-bridge connection between both sides of course). Bridge tiles getting their own domain value would probably work best for that and will also benefit in early rejecting trying to path to a destroyed bridge. And 'living' bridges would reference connections between domains, if a bridge is destroyed it dereferences the connection, and the connection is removed when there are zero references (zero bridges between domains).

I'm thinking on working on this when I get some time, maybe do some profiling first, but I wanted to throw it on here first.

data.title: Fixed domain index updates for bridges
data.body:
When the bridge damage state changes, the domain cells of the bridge
would pull in the first neighbors domain which may be untraversable.
This change only pulls the domain of traversable neighbor tiles.

Fixes #7539.
Fixes #6684.

data.title: Alpha fade-in/fade-out effect support on sprite sequences
data.body:
Implement Westwood like alpha fader trait/blending mode (Translucent=yes) that runs animation with 3 stages (or more for smoother) of alpha transparency toward fade out. 

WW does sorta /3 amount(?) of shp frames to for the value used: 25,50,75, in ORA this would be 75,50,25 order.

This would allow replicate effect fade out used in TS/RA2.

data.title: Unhardcode the palette the missile weapon of the NukePower uses
data.body: Just some unhardcoding and documenting.

data.title: Remove asset requirement from dedicated servers and the resource site.
data.body:
Partially reverts #10687 so that we don't force the asset requirement on all dedicated servers and the resource site.  The ContentInstaller tests when launching the game itself ensures that the content is installed before running the game.

This is intended as a shortish term fix for until the server code is adapted to handle itself properly.

data.title: Fix mod assembly loading on Windows.
data.body: This fixes a regression from #10706 that would cause multiple copies of the mod assemblies to be loaded into the domain and subsequent bogus crashes.

data.title: Do not crash during importing a TS map if a waypoint ID isn't an integer.
data.body: While FinalAlert itself does not insert waypoints with IDs having alpabetical characters, mappers could manually place waypoints where the IDs could contain such.

data.title: Load Loadscreen images via the virtual filesystem.
data.body: You all know the drill by now.  This ports load screens to use the VFS in preparation for #10703.

data.title: [RA] The official map pool. Altering existing maps.
data.body:
I encourage you to give specific feedback/contribututions to: 
**The Official Map Pool - collaboration thread** 
http://www.sleipnirstuff.com/forum/viewtopic.php?f=82&p=294875#294875

I've gone through the existing RA maps and noted specific changes that IMO needs to be done. The changes are partially aesthetic and some balance related. This may or may not give the map new life but in any case they will look much better in the map chooser and in-game. If we are to hold on to the classic maps, they should at least be up to par with competing maps on aesthetics and balance. I've done my best to preserve as much of the maps' original character with the recommended changes.

Separate issues will eventually be submitted for each map for a final review and chance for additional discussion. All maps have been thoroughly playtested and altered after feedback from players before being submitted individually.

Map and author names should stay unchanged unless the map is altered a lot beyond it's original structure.

**Map list:**

Screenshots and comparisons are found on the altered maps' pages.

[**Forest Path**](http://resource.openra.net/maps/7295/) (2 players)
Move player spawns one cell away horizontally from the ore patches.
Change layout of actors around secondary ore patches to equalize access for both spawns.
Switch out actors (trees) to vary the fauna.
[Altered](http://resource.openra.net/maps/9138)
**Playtested, submitted at #10928**

[**Keep Off The Grass 2**](http://resource.openra.net/maps/7242/) (2 players)
Move the first ore patch for both spawns to balance ore access.
[Altered](http://resource.openra.net/maps/9542/) *updated to revision 5, March 29th
also see #10347 

**Playtested, submitted at #10954**

[**Man to Man**](http://resource.openra.net/maps/7196/) (2 players)
Remove oil derricks -or- access them by bridge.
[Altered](http://resource.openra.net/maps/9230/)
also see #10312
**Playtested, submitted at #10953**

[**Sidestep**](http://resource.openra.net/maps/8176/) (2 players)
Add edge ridges for more distinction.
Add more roads, actors and debris to make the map less blank.
[Altered](http://resource.openra.net/maps/9353/)
**Playtested, submitted at #10927**

[**Singles**](http://resource.openra.net/maps/7353/) (2 players)
Map structure overhaul. see #10301
Work on balance and aesthetics.
[Altered](http://resource.openra.net/maps/9487)
**Playtested, submitted at #10987**

[**Snowy Ridge**](http://resource.openra.net/maps/7996/) (3 players)
Move the first ore patch for all spawns to balance ore access.
Move horizontal ridge north to equalize size of north/south fields.
[Altered](http://resource.openra.net/maps/9373/)
also see #10712
**Playtested, submitted at #10952**

[**Doubles**](http://resource.openra.net/maps/7153/) (4 players)
Map structure overhaul. see #10303
Work on balance and aesthetics.
[Altered](http://resource.openra.net/maps/9489/)
**Playtested, submitted at #10988**

[**Chokepoint**](http://resource.openra.net/maps/7285/) (4 players)
Make the corners' cliff and ore more symmetrical.
Narrow the top water a little on it's west side so player A and D symmetrically has equal fields towards the chokes.
[Altered](http://resource.openra.net/maps/8920/)
**Playtested, submitted at #10833**

[**East vs West**](http://resource.openra.net/maps/7583/) (4 players)
Add more detail scenery.
Tweak spawn spots so as making them distinguishable in the lobby.
[Altered](http://resource.openra.net/maps/9367/)
**Playtested, submitted at #10950**

[**Temperal**](http://resource.openra.net/maps/7233/) (4 players)
Add actors and debris to out-of-reach and vacant areas.
Slightly tweak the north players poor economic start position.
[Altered](http://resource.openra.net/maps/9456/)
**Playtested, submitted at #10980**

[**Asymmetric Battle**](http://resource.openra.net/maps/6790/) (6 players)
Add actors (trees) to areas unlikely to be used for base-building and battle.
[Altered](http://resource.openra.net/maps/9157/)
**Playtested, submitted at #10951**

[**Encounter**](http://resource.openra.net/maps/7290/) (6 players) 
Make the corner ridges more symmetrical.
Make all ridges more distinctive.
Balance east/west ore patches for corner player spawns.
[Altered](http://resource.openra.net/maps/9516/)
**Playtested, submitted at #10798**

[**High & Low**](http://resource.openra.net/maps/7999/) - 8 players
East/west are uneven in build areas, distance to deploy site and the map is slightly offset from the middle. Needs an overhaul.
Make ridges around player spawns more distinctive.
Add roads from the edges of player spawns leading out to the middle ground.
[Altered](http://resource.openra.net/maps/9457/)
**Playtested, submitted at #10979**

[**North by Northwest**](http://resource.openra.net/maps/6720/) (8 players)
Add more ore mines.
Remove 4 x middle edge ore patches, replace with debris.
Remove trees outside 4 entrances to the middle ground.
Add decorative trees.
[Altered](http://resource.openra.net/maps/9486/)
**Playtested, submitted at #10985**

[**Mass Confliction**](http://resource.openra.net/maps/7427/) (12 players)
Fix uneven build areas east/west (8 cell difference!)
Make ridges more symmetrical east/west.
Make ridges more distinctive.
[Altered](http://resource.openra.net/maps/9376/)
**Playtested, submitted at #10949**

**Additional altered maps by other users:**

[Artic Triangle Resort](http://resource.openra.net/maps/8081/) (3 players) -Major structural overhaul including balanced ore access.

**Suggested maps to be altered:** - Murto The Ray

[Artic Triangle Affair](http://resource.openra.net/maps/1313/) (3 players)
Make starting ore equidistant from spawns and make room for all player's MCVs in middle.

[First Come, First Served](http://resource.openra.net/maps/7249/) (4 players)
Widen center passage to encourage larger armies.

[Puddles Redux](http://resource.openra.net/maps/7961/) (4 players)
Take ore from near middle and place nearer starting positions.

[Tabula Rasa](http://resource.openra.net/maps/6750/) (4 players)
Make oil derrick valley entrance equal in size for both sides.

[Vegetation](http://resource.openra.net/maps/8066/) (6 players)
Widen gap between players and add small gap where walls join with the outer wall.

data.title: Clean up the filesystem code
data.body:
The virtual filesystem (VFS) code is/was a giant ball of technical debt, and cleaning it up will win us a lot of perf and feature improvements.  This ticket tracks the previous and future progress on the issue.
- [x] Un-global the FileSystem class. [#9853]
- [x] Streamline the package interface, moving the various mix-format workarounds from engine code into the mix file parser. [#10525, #10530, #10535, #10554]
- [x] Replace direct-filesystem lookups with VFS lookups. [#10687, #10703, #10704, #10705, #10706, #10713]
- [x] Reference maps via their packages instead of paths [#10786]
- [x] Restore "All packages" listing in the asset browser [#10716]
- [x] Separate Map and MapPreview, and only load Map when absolutely necessary:
  - [x] Remove Map references from MapPreview [#10697]
  - [x] Remove automatic map format updating [#10701]
  - [x] Load map metadata without initializing throwaway maps. [#10768]
  - [x] Load map previews without initializing throwaway maps.
  - [x] Use MapPreviews in the server code.
    - [x] Support querying the resource API directly, removing the need for dedicated servers to sync maps. [#10717]
  - [x] Use MapPreviews in the lobby code.
- [x] Implement `IReadOnlyFileSystem` interface, and replace use of `Game.ModData.ModFiles` with a passed `IReadOnlyFileSystem` object. [#10765]
- [x] Split sequence initialization out of RuleSet, and store the SequenceProvider on the individual Map and defaults in a `DefaultSequences` dictionary (keyed by tileset) on ModData.
- [x] Remove the lazy loading in Map.
- [x] Add support for "oramod" packages. [[pchote/oramod](https://github.com/pchote/OpenRA/commits/oramod)]
## <bountysource-plugin>

Want to back this issue? **[Post a bounty on it!](https://www.bountysource.com/issues/30624381-clean-up-the-filesystem-code?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github)** We accept bounties via [Bountysource](https://www.bountysource.com/?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github).
</bountysource-plugin>

data.title: Re-enabled All Packages which seems to be fast enough now.
data.body: It pops up instantly even for Red Alert 2. Not sure what kind of performance problems we were suffering in the past, they seem to be gone now. This is way more practical if you are setting up sequences with sprites scattered around in tileset specific MIX files.

data.title: Added a TS/RA2 sprite sequence importer for infantry and buildings
data.body: These are traditionally time consuming to do manually.

data.title: Added basic RA2/TS mod rules importers
data.body: Useful when setting up a large amount of decorational props.

data.title: Unify static mod metadata collections.
data.body:
This merges the static Manifest collection into the static ModMetadata collection and replaces the path reference with a Package reference.

This is one of the last pieces of plumbing for supporting oramod packages: once the rest of the engine is using the virtual filesystem properly (#10704, #10706, #10703) it's as simple as adding an `else` case to `ModMetadata.ValidateMods` to return the oramod container instead of a folder.

data.title: ra: Remove caffeinated, snowy-ridge
data.body:
These are both terrible.

Caffeinated is my old RA95 study of how much
detailing you could get away with; it has horribly unbalanced resources
and spawn locations.

Snowy-ridge is a 1v1v1 so small that you can shoot from one base to
another, and the bottom player has a serious disadvantage.

Signed-off-by: Chris Forbes chrisf@ijw.co.nz

data.title: Refactored ticks to delay per issue #9810
data.body: Per issue #9810: refactored ticks to delay in all the specified files pointed out by @atlimit8. Added upgrade rule to properly translate to yaml.

data.title: [RA] The official map pool. ...in with the new.
data.body:
The hardest maps to replace are the 6 player maps and up since few people are making regular mass player maps, and they vary greatly in quality. However here's a list containing some 2-player maps, and a variety of team and FFA maps. 

**Playtested**:

[Behind The Veil](http://resource.openra.net/maps/8795/) (2 players)
[Dual Cold Front](http://resource.openra.net/maps/9160/) (2 players)
[Northwest Passage](http://resource.openra.net/maps/8564/) (2 players)
[Warwind](http://resource.openra.net/maps/8925/) (2 players)
[Winter Storm](http://resource.openra.net/maps/6902/) (2 players)
[Sunstroke](http://resource.openra.net/maps/9020/) (3 players, FFA)
[Sudden Death](http://resource.openra.net/maps/9356/) (5 players, FFA)
[Pool Party](http://resource.openra.net/maps/9134/) (10 players, 5v5)

**Re-instate map removed from the latest playtest/bleed**:
[Caffeinated](http://resource.openra.net/maps/7369/) (8 players)

This map is the same map type, size and has the same player number (8) as Raraku. Raraku is a monstrosity and is suggested for removal in #10708. Imo, Raraku looks hideous, the map itself and in the map chooser, but also has poor options for team play and FFA. Caffeinated on the other hand looks decent as a non-symmetrical map, has multiple options for team-play, even multiple 4v4 positions. Personally, the games I remember on this map was generally fun. The are numerous maps  in the map pool currently that should be dumped _way_ before Caffeinated.

data.title: Default Game Speed doesn't change?
data.body:
So, I wanted to make the Fastest game speed the default. I made these changes: http://pastebin.com/qs5DASzK and it sort of worked. In the lobby options, Fastest is the default selected game speed. Actually in game though the game speed **remains unchanged** from normal despite Fastest being highlighted in the lobby. I have to change the game speed to something else than back to Fastest for the game speed to actually be Fastest.

data.title: [RA] The official map pool. Out with the old...
data.body:
As requested here's a list of maps I believe think should be wiped off the official map pool. We need to take advantage of newer and better maps from the resource center and make sure we regularly replace the outdated and old. This will also encourage people to make more and better maps for the future.

This list I think presents the worst ones and imo are beyond salvage. The list progress in the same order as in the official map tab in-game.

[Burlesca](http://resource.openra.net/maps/7126/) (2 players)
[Styrian Mountains](http://resource.openra.net/maps/7284/) (2 players)
[Contact](http://resource.openra.net/maps/7537/) (4 players)
[Island Hoppers](http://resource.openra.net/maps/6925/) (4 players)
[Pearly Wastelands](http://resource.openra.net/maps/7292/) (4 players)
[Breaking Point](http://resource.openra.net/maps/7544/) (8 players)
[Central Conflict](http://resource.openra.net/maps/7541/) (8 players)
[Raraku](http://resource.openra.net/maps/7179/) (8 players) (swap with Caffeinated, see #10710)
[Ring of Fire](http://resource.openra.net/maps/7273/) (8 players)
[High & Low Extended](http://resource.openra.net/maps/7357/) (10 players)

data.title: Fix mobile checks
data.body: Follow up to #10696 to allow us to do mobility checks without a real actor. SpawnMPUnits needs this so we do need the check after all (otherwise the game crashes) - this is the cleanest way I can see to do it.

data.title: Loads mod assemblies via the virtual filesystem.
data.body:
Prerequisite to #10703 and oramods.

Unfortunately this delays the time to first loadscreen render, but I don't see any alternatives.

data.title: Fix lint test yaml loading.
data.body:
Fixes a couple of leftovers I missed in #10687.

Prerequisite to #10703 and oramods.

data.title: Loads fonts via the virtual filesystem.
data.body: Prerequisite to #10703 and oramods.

data.title: Unify filesystem package syntax.
data.body:
This unifies our handling of mod/package specific files with common code in the virtual file system.

There are three new/changed syntax elements for use in yaml:
1. `explicit-name|file` specifies that `file` should be loaded from the package that has been explicitly named `explicit-name`.
2. `package: explicit-name` in the `Packages:` section of `mod.yaml` defines an explicitly named package that can be referenced using the `|` syntax.
3. `$mod` in the `Packages:` section of `mod.yaml` defines that the mod named `mod` should be mounted as a package.  Mods may be loaded from either the system or support dirs, and will eventually support both unpacked and oramods.

As a compromise based on the earlier discussions/arguments I have changed the explicit package operator from `:` to `|` and reverted the change for `MapFolders`.

This has the side-effect of making all our default mods portable between the system and support directories.

Supersedes #10487.

data.title: Fix Map.Contains for maps with height
data.body:
Fixes #10460.
Fixes #10698.
Fixes OpenRA/ra2#85.

Changed the logic so a cell with no valid projected cells is now considered off the map - previously such a cell would be considered inside the map.

Also trimmed down the debug messaged introduced in #10592 a bit now we have a fix.

data.title: Remove automatic map format upgrades and add versioned user map dirs
data.body:
This removes the "feature" where we would automatically update maps to the latest format when they are loaded, which has caused problems with the resource center and people switching between releases and playtests.  It also gets us a step closer to immutable maps, which will open up some new perf improvements.  Map format upgrades are now done when running the mod/map upgrade rules.

To avoid the game trying and failing to load a bunch of outdated versions on startup I have added per-version map folders.  If somebody wants to copy their self-made map to a newer version of the game they will need to either (a) manually copy it to the new version directory, and then possibly run the upgrader, or (b) let the resource center automatically upgrade it, and then redownload it when joining a server on the new version.
